title: 820-3476-A 16mA
message:
I'm working on a water damaged 820-3476-A. I did a lot of work, cleaning the board and changing this parts:
C5120, C7095, C7102, R7095, R7096, C3740, C2951, R7080, C5131, C1950, Q7520, Q5490, R5491, R5492, Q5480, R5481, R5482, U5110.

I did a reflow for U5000.

The naked board starts with 36mA for half a second, falls down to 9mA and goes up to 16mA after a second. Green light flashes for 2 Seconds and then orange light stable.
After soldering Q5490 und Q5480 the board was a bit warm and it took for one start something between 200-300 mA and the ventilator was running. This was only one time.

Here are my measurements:
PPBUS_G3H = 8,6v
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING = 8,6v
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V = 8,6v
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER3V3 = 8,6v
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL = 19,0v
PPDCIN_G3H = 19,0v
PP3V42_G3H = 3,42v
PPVRTC_G3H = 3,3v
PP5V_S5 = 5,0v
   PP5V_S4 = 0,0V
   PP5V_S0 = 0,0v
PP3V3_S5 = 3,3v
   PP3V3_S4 = 0,0v
   PP3V3_SUS = 0,0v
   PP3V3_S3 = 0,02v
   PP3V3_S0 = 0,1v

P5VS4_DRVH = 0,0v
PM_SLP_S4_L = 0v

My troubleshooting has now stalled. It would be great if you could help me further.

title: 820-3476-A 16mA
message:
Check PM_BATLOW_L, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PM_RSMRST_L, SMC_ADAPTER_EN and the 4 PCH's RTC (DC) signals.

Original 60/85W Magsafe 2 charger?
Did you test with lab PSU, or fake charger too?

title: 820-3476-A 16mA
message:
PM_BATLOW_L = 3.3v
PCH_DSWVRMEN = 3.2v
PM_DSW_PWRGD = 3.4v
PM_RSMRST_L = 0.0v
SMC_ADAPTER_EN = 3.38v

I found these PCH RTC signals - did you mean this? Sorry for stupid asking :-(
PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 = 0.4v
PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3.3v
PPVOUT_S0_PCH_DCPRTC = 1.4v

I was testing with lab PSU and Magsafe2 cable from a 85W. Also with Original 85W Magsafe2 - same behavior.

title: 820-3476-A 16mA
message:
I specified 4 DC signals...

"PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3.3v"
Nothing more appears close to it (in the same PCH block)?

title: 820-3476-A 16mA
message:
This three are shown together on page 72 in the schematic:
PCH_SRTCRST_L = 3.3v
PCH_CLK32K_RTCX1 = 0.4v
RTC_RESET_L = (3.3v
These are the only signals with PCH and RTC in the name (searching in FlexBV).

Searching for RTC only, i found this two signals more:
PPVOUT_S0_PCH_DCPRTC = 1.4v
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.3v

Maybe i have a shitty boardview and schematic for this board? Should I look for someone else?

title: 820-3476-A 16mA
message:
We've talked many times about RTC signals on the forum.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
The mentioned signals go to RTC block; didn't say to have RTC in name!

Just in case, check SMC_S5_PWRGD_VIN too.

Missing PM_SLP_SUS_L, having all previous signals OK, points to PCH problem.
However, we are still pending about PCH_INTRUDER_L and PCH_INTVRMEN.

title: 820-3476-A 16mA
message:
Ok, thanks for the clarification because of the RTC signals. Here are the missing values ...

SMC_S5_PWRGD_VIN = 3.38v
PCH_INTRUDER_L = 3.0v
PCH_INTVRMEN = 3.2v

title: 820-3476-A 16mA
message:
Possibly accumulated crap underneath PCH.
Try heating it with quality flux.
